Author: TShell#0416
Content: Hi, I  use native mode. After upgrading from 0.2.41d to 0.2.43d , it takes too long to be fully synced, more than 1 day. Is this normal?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Hi @TShell Are you using same hardware and operating system as before (when you synced 0.2.41d)?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Synchronisation in Native mode depends of your drive IOPS (on SSD it's much much faster) and  internet connection speed (blocks downloading on your PC)

Author: TShell#0416
Content: Yes, I use the same one. I have also used SSD. All I did is update, the result of which looks like reindexing from the scratch.

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Is synchronisation stuck on some height or it's going  but slow?

Author: TShell#0416
Content: I tried on two different SSDs. The first one was stuck at 94.60%, so I stopped and changed into lite mode. The second is verifying blocks slowly.

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Could you please open a email ticket to support@komodoplatform.com if synchronisation will stuck again? By the way which OS are you using?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: You're most welcome! Windows OS usually also adding some "slowness" if compare with Linux. There are various reasons why it's started to sync from scratch (e.g. blocks database was corrupted on starts/stops). If there some states when sync is stuck on your side it should possible to get additional information via daemon logs so please feel free to contact us to troubleshoot.

Author: Seko#7408
Content: Will Jumblr be possible in Lite mode?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: No. Jumblr uses z-Addresses which are not supported in lite-mode

Author: Seko#7408
Content: With sapling we can solve the problem?

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: "The Jumblr process is managed locally on the user’s machine and requires no third parties, human coordination, or other mixing services."

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: I think that the main focus is to do all this process in your own machine to avoid depending on any third party outside of your computer.

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: Thanks @Gordon Komodo  I asked him to make a ticket to avoid spamming the thread.

Author: Psipherious#2635
Content: Guys is it possible to export a seed? or is it only possible to get the seed when initially creating a new wallet?

Author: Nabob#5004
Content: You cannot export seed, only created when using new wallet. but you can export private key from Seed

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: @Psipherious you can do it through `Settings > export keys > enter pin > get seed`
